title.narrative: Lao PDR Second Trade Development Facility Project

description.narrative: The project development objective is to support the implementation of government's trade and integration priorities outlined inthe2012 DTIS Roadmap, and in particular to contribute to improved competitiveness and diversification, focusing outside the naturalresource sectors.

Department of Imports and Exports, Ministry of Industry and Commerce

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Appointment of additional FM staff | Description :The Recipient shall complete the recruitment of additionalfinancial management staff required for the Project. | Due Date :01-Jul-2013

Finance Agreement :Appointment of an auditor | Description :The Recipient shall, within three (3) months of the Effective Date: (a)appoint an auditor on terms of reference acceptable to the Association | Due Date :01-Jul-2013

Finance Agreement :Availability of FMM and BAF Operations Manual and conflict between provisions. | Description :The Recipientshall ensure that the Financial Management Manual and the BAF Operations Manual are made available at all times and applied in thecarrying out of the Project. In the event of any conflict between the provisions of the Financial Management Manual, the BAFOperations Manual and those of this Agreement, the latter shall prevail. | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :BAF Management Contract | Description :The Recipient shall, within three (3) months of the Effective Date: (b)complete the recruitment of a BAF team on terms of reference acceptable to the Association to support the NIU in the implementationof Part B.1 of the Project | Due Date :01-Jul-2013

Finance Agreement :BAF Matching Grant Agreements | Description :BAF shall exercise its rights under each Matching Grant Agreementin such manner as to protect the interests of the Recipient and the Association and to accomplish the purposes of the Financing.Except as the Association shall otherwise agree in writing, the Beneficiary shall not assign, amend, abrogate or waive any MatchingGrant Agreement or any of its provisions. | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :BAF Operations Manual Matching Grant administration | Description :Matching Grants are provided following theguidelines, procedures and selection criteria set forth in the BAF Operations Manual. A Matching Grant Agreement shall be enteredon terms and conditions approved by the Association and outlined in the BAF Operations Manual for each Matching Grant. The amountof each Matching Grant shall be determined in accordance with the provisions of the Manual. | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Changes to the FMM or BAF Operations Manual | Description :The Recipient shall undertake not to amend, suspend,abrogate, repeal or waive or permit to be amended, suspended, abrogated, repealed, or waived, any provisions of the FinancialManagement Manual and of the BAF Operations Manual without the prior written agreement of the Association. | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Financial Management Manual | Description :The Recipient shall, within one (1) month of the Effective Date adopta Financial Management Manual satisfactory to the Association. | Due Date :01-May-2013

Finance Agreement :National Implementation Unit | Description :The Ministry of Industry and Commerce shall maintain, at all timesduring implementation of the Project a National Implementation Unit with a mandate, terms of reference and composition that issatisfactory to the Association. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Project carried out in accordance with the BAF Operations Manual | Description :The Recipient shall adopt andcarry out or cause to be carried out the Matching Grants in accordance with the BAF Operations Manual. | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Project carried out in accordance with the Financial Management Manual | Description :The Recipient shall carryout or cause to be carried out the Project in accordance with the Financial Management Manual . | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Trade Program Executive Committee | Description :The Recipient shall maintain, at all times duringimplementation of the Project, a Trade Program Executive Committee with a mandate, terms of reference and composition that issatisfactory to the Association. | Frequency :Yearly

title.narrative: Increase in number of hits for Lao PDR Trade Portal (per year)
Cumulative number of issues and concerns raised by small and women-led enterprises captured and actioned through the Lao Business Forum
Cumulative number of garment factory labor standards assessed
Cumulative number of BAF grant approvals
Sales growth in BAF supported firms compared to non-supported firms
Average percentage of female owned businesses among approved applications by BAF
Within those businesses, percentage of women employed
Successful completion rates for Trade Facilitation capacity building program
Reduced mean number of days to clear imports
Reduction in the mean number of days required for services firms to obtain operating licenses
Reduction in the mean number of days required to obtain import licenses
Number of products at 6-digit level of the Harmonized System with exports exceeding USD 100,000 in a year
Increased share of firms with female management/ownership participation
Frequency and participation of National Trade Facilitation Secretariat meetings to resolve trade facilitation issues, with decisions documented and follow up actions prioritized
Reduction in percent of firms identifying customs and trade regulations as a major constraint
Reduced mean number of days to clear exports
Improved aid for trade governance moving toward a program based approach operating under the TPSWG

target.value: Coordinated, Joint work planning and result monitoring supervised by the TPSWG

actual.value: Coordinated, joint work planning and results monitoring supervised by the Trade and Private Sector Working Group (TPSWG)

title.narrative: Perception of Lao Business Forum’s effectiveness increased

target.value: 60% perceive LBF as at least somewhat effective

actual.value: 94% at least somewhat effective (somewhat effective 42%, and very effective 52%)

title.narrative: Cumulative number of new regulations adopted affecting the telecom sector / insurance sector / professional services
Number of new company registrations per year in non-resource sectors
